answers.author: Karen Thoreson
answers.text:
Greg - ASU partnered with the City of Phoenix to develop a downtown ASU campus. Part of that was entering into an additional partnership with the downtown YMCA which had an old fitness center. ASU upgraded that for (both ASU students and the public use) and now with donated land next door to that facility ASU is building an expanded facility and student center.   I can see it, it is being constructed across the park from my office window.

I don't have personal experience, but locally there is the Freedom Center in Manassas VA.  They are a partnership between George Mason Univ., City of Manassas and Prince William County.  you could contact them (unfortunatley I don't know anyone working there anymore).
their website:  http://www.freedom-center.com/
hope this helps.

author: Gregory Stopka
text: I am looking for examples of how local governments have partnered with local universities or colleges to fund and/or operate a fitness center. What have you done in this area?  What model did you use? Any help is greatly appreciated.
title: Joint Local Government-University Fitness Centers
